results.title: Small planet
results.creator_credit: International Civil Aviation Organization and United Nations
results.brief_description: Jet planes in civil aviation and the services provided by ICAO. The types of jet in use; the elaborate ground services they require; the role of ICAO in studying civil aviation needs, coordinating services and supplying financial and technical asistance. Stresses the shrinkage of distance and the growth of cooperation through air travel.

results.title: Small people
results.brief_description: The fun and fascination of puppetry. Based on the work of Edith Munay, who pioneered the teaching of puppetry to Australian children. The wide range of interest includes the puppets to make, their clothes, the story to be thought of, the play to be worked out, the manipulation, the gestures and voices of the characters; glove puppets, animal puppets, rod puppets and marionettes, all are shown in this introduction to puppetry.

results.title: Small pebbles on a giant shore
results.creator_credit: Maria Stratford and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Describes problems of disabled non-English speaking immigrants in Australia. Shows how some of these special groups have received assistance through the help of ADEC (Action on Disability within Ethnic Communities).

results.title: Small island, big fight (A)
results.creator_credit: Aven S Noah, Trevor Graham, Rosemary Hesp, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Film Australia and Junjidys Productions
results.brief_description: …Where I come from is Murray Island. We call it Mer. The home of the famous Mabo land rights case. We won that battle, but now we’ve got a new fight on our hands…this time with outside fishing fleets over who can profit from our waters. (Aven S. Noah) Situated on the eastern side of the Torres Strait between Papua New Guinea and Australia, Murray Island or Mer, is home to around 450 indigenous people with each family belonging to one of eight clans. Following the historic Mabo case which won recognition for traditional ownership of their land, the Mer people are now fighting for the same recognition of their sea - land and sea are all part of Aboriginal territory and have a historical cultural link to their spiritual beliefs and customs. Their sea is being invaded by commercial fishing fleets and local islanders are struggling to compete - already some have left the Island and three-quarters of the population are on welfare. What has not been resolved by the Mabo case must now be resolved by the Torres Strait Treaty which was designed to protect indigenous rights to fishing and environmental concerns. The documentary presents all sides to the argument including interviews with the commercial fishermen, Mer Island fishermen and community leaders, and legal representatives for the Mer people as well as archival footage of Eddie “Koiki” Mabo discussing sea rights in 1989. Narrated by Aven S. Noah.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Aven S Noah, Trevor Graham, Rosemary Hesp, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Film Australia and Junjidys Productions

results.title: Small is beautiful
results.creator_credit: Donald Brittain, Barrie Howells, Douglas Kiefer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Challenge for change/Societe nouvelle”.
Up to age forty-five, Fritz Schumacher, economist, technologist and lecturer, was dedicated to economic growth. Then he came to believe that the modern technological explosion had grown out of all proportion to human need. Author of Small Is Beautiful - A Study of Economics as if People Mattered and founder of the London-based Intermediate Technology Development Group, he championed the cause of “appropriate” technology. The film brings us into contact with this gentle revolutionary a few months before his death.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Brittain, Barrie Howells, Douglas Kiefer and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Small happiness : Life in a Chinese village (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Richard Gordon, Carma Hinton and Long Bow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Long Bow Trilogy”.
Despite the tremendous advances women in China have made, serious problems continue. Long Bow women talk about love, marriage, work, birth control, birth customs and the now outlawed custom of foot binding. Truly moving interviews with a Long Bow woman and her mother-in-law draw us into their lives.

results.title: Small faces
results.creator_credit: Gillies MacKinnon, Steve Clark-Hall, Billy MacKinnon and Skyline Easterhouse Ltd (Glasgow)
results.brief_description: Set in Glasgow in the late 1960’s, ‘Small faces’ is a gritty depiction of three working class brothers coming of age in an environment of gang warfare. The eldest, wayward Bobby is in the Glens, Alan, the artistic middle son is in love with the girl downstairs, and the youngest son Lex is creating the most cause for concern when he accidentally shoots the leader of the Tongs, mental Malky (Kevin McKidd), in the eye with an air rifle. The actions of Lex draw in Alan, the last of the MacLeans to be involved in the Glen/Tong animosity, setting a momentum they cannot control and forcing the brothers to question their loyalty between family and friends. Their story is set against a strong home environment, one in which their mother is acutely aware of their heritage and a time when things were better, yet also devoid of obvious male role models as Lex is torn between Alan and Bobby, and Bobby turning to the Glens without question. Cast includes Claire Higgins, Iain Robertson, Joseph McFadden and Laura Fraser.

results.title: Small claims tribunal
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Follows the case of a consumer making a complaint to the Consumer Affairs Bureau about a dress that shrank after washing. The claim is subsequently settled before the Small Claims Tribunal. No other credits available

results.title: Small business: the company you keep
results.creator_credit: Paul Ellis, Tony Matthews and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: How to approach the problems of delegation, staff selection, and the future management of the company. As a business grows, those at the top must learn a new role. In addition to delegation, which is examined from several angles, there are important problems of communication and industrial relations.
